column4: hi, what is this restricted driver "wl" which come down on updates yesterday?
how is**
b43 is a reverse enginenred driver, wl is released directly from the manufacturer, wl is the best driver
ah, ok, so should i get rid of b43 then?
ok, they are both checked now, so I guess I'll just uncheck b43
yeah, do so
hi, tried disabling the b43, but it didn't work. Got a feeling "Broadcom B43" is the driver and "wl" is the firmware
are you using a dell?
yes
which one?
inspiron
i know exaclty what the problem is, i also use an e1505

basically, the new wl driver cant subside with the ssb, b43 driver but your modem uses the b44 driver which relies on the ssb driver. so for wl to work, you hav to blacklist b43, b44 and ssb but then you can use wired connections cos your modem deosnt have a driver.
yes? is it anything to do with this really bad network bug in intrepid?
no, the network bug is something else
ssb?
ssb module, both b43 and b44(the modem driver) rely on it
ok, thanks. i'll probably stick with b43 for now. it works.

yeah, i always use wireless so it was easy for me to just switch to wl and junk the b43,b44, ssb driver. when i want to use a wired connection, i just manually unload the wl driver and then load the b44 and ssb driver
sounds a pain in the arse TBH
i use the wired connection, once in every month, so its perfect for me to use the wl for the rest fo the time. faster speeds when i sue wl instead of b43
interesting. are there any other advantages of wl over b43?
signal quality is better, b43 used to output a lot of errors ito my system log, no more errors ever since i started using wl. Personall, the greatest perk is the speed. very vast difference for me.
